meanings.def: the part of the unconscious mind where many of a person’s basic needs, feelings and desires are supposed to exist
an official way of showing who you are, for example a document with your name, date of birth and often a photograph on it (the abbreviation for ‘identity’ or ‘identification’)
examples: You must carry ID at all times.
The police checked IDs at the gate.
The government is trying to introduce compulsory ID cards.
You will need some form of photo ID.

meanings.def: identification (= the fact of showing, proving or recognizing who or what somebody/something is)
examples: The police need a witness to make a positive ID.

meanings.def: to identify somebody, usually a criminal or a dead body
examples: The police haven’t yet managed to ID the suspect.

meanings.def: to ask somebody to show a document that shows proof of their name, age, etc.
examples: The security guards ID’d everyone at the entrance to the festival.

meanings.def: one of the two main Muslim festivals, either Id ul-Fitr /iːd ʌl fɪtə(r)/ at the end of Ramadan, or Id ul-Adha /iːd ʌl ʌdə/, which celebrates the end of the pilgrimage to Mecca and Abraham’s sacrifice of a sheep
